intro: Molkenboeria pilosa, commonly known as the hairy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its milky sap is a distinguishing feature, which can be toxic to some animals. Molkenboeria pilosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats.
